FuncDef: The display dhcp lease-proxy-table command displays lease proxy entries of DHCP users on an interface board.
CLIs: display dhcp lease-proxy-table slot <slot> { all | first-step }
display dhcp lease-proxy-table slot <slot> { mac-address <mac-address> [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-num> } peVlan <pe-vlan> ceVlan <ce-vlan> ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 16  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Display all DHCP access user information.
-

Display brief information about lease proxy entries in the first step.
-

Specifies a MAC address.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0. The MAC address cannot be set to FFFF-FFFF-FFFF.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies the outer VLAN ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4094.

Specifies the inner VLAN ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In DHCP user access scenarios, to query brief information about all lease proxy entries, detailed information about a specified entry, and relevant lease proxy entries, run the display dhcp lease-proxy-table command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
